snippet: The City Council in Tripoli, where the deputy intelligence chief was seized, called a general strike to demand that militias leave the city.
abstract: Mustafa Noah, deputy chief of Libya’s intelligence service, is abducted from parking lot of Tripoli airport as standoff between militias and protests against militia rule virtually shut down city.

byline.contributor: Osama Alfitory contributed reporting from Tripoli, Libya.

lead_paragraph: The City Council in Tripoli, where the deputy intelligence chief was seized, called a general strike to demand that militias leave the city.

headline.main: Libyan Official Abducted Amid Unrest in Capital
headline.print_headline: Libyan Official Abducted Amid Unrest in Capital

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
